oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 184-186 Second Avenue North architectural survey, circa 1980, 1994
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kirkpatrick Building

Architecture; Buildings; Business; Capitol City; Downtown Nashville; Architectural surveys--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture--Details; Architecture--Tennessee--Nashville; Architecture, Victorian--Tennessee--Nashville; Buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Central business districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Commercial buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic buildings--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic districts--Tennessee--Nashville; Historic preservation--Tennessee--Nashville; History--Societies, etc.--Tennessee--Nashville
Nashville (Tenn.)--Buildings, structures, etc.; Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Second Avenue (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Detailed architectural and historical survey of the building spanning the addresses of 184 Second Avenue North and 186 Second Avenue North. Items consist of photographs and documents created from 1980 to 1994. Black and white photographs are of the exterior front or street view of the building. Some photographs may also show storefronts, signs, pedestrians, vehicles, and street scenes. Documents contain architectural descriptions, compilations of deed and city directory research, and other research notes. This building was built around 1900. It is made of brick and is three stories tall. Forms part of Historic Nashville Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Historic Nashville, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church St., Nashville, Tennessee 37219
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Historic Nashville, Inc. Downtown Survey, Series I. Downtown Survey
